meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - It's time to knock it out of the park (get it?) with my review of Cricket 24!

As I dive into the world of cricket, I'm reminded of those infamous cricket critics who seem more focused on critiquing than critiquing. Yes, you know the ones - IGN, Digitally Downloaded, Push Square, VideoGamer, GamingBolt, and Press Start Australia. They all had their say, but let's be real, no one has time for 50/50 cricket (ahem, like Cricket 24's score).

So, what's the big deal? Well, aside from some lovely visuals and presentation, there aren't too many significant changes from its predecessor, Cricket 22. It's like playing a replay during a rain delay - you might as well just re-watch the highlights. But hey, if you're new to the game (or cricket itself), this could be an exciting introduction.

One thing that stands out is the sheer number of licensed modes - relive those epic Ashes battles or forge a lengthy career. It's like having Gilly in your backyard (okay, maybe not that much). And hey, who doesn't love a good game of 20/20 cricket? (Just me, right?)

But let's get real; the AI and presentation still need some fine-tuning. And don't even get me started on those bugs and glitches - it's like trying to bowl a googly without any spin!

All in all, Cricket 24 is a solid, if not spectacular, addition to the series. It's a mixed bag of fun, with moments where you'll be hitting sixes out of the park (pun intended). If you're already invested in past games, it might feel like a minor update. But for new players, it's an accessible and enjoyable experience.

So, there you have it - Hippo Penny's Cricket 24 review: not entirely a home run, but definitely worth batting at!
